VLIB_originalfast9_score

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_originalfast9_score (const uint8_t *restrict img, uint16_t stride, const uint32_t *featuresLoc, uint32_t numFeatures, uint8_t b, uint8_t *restrict score, uint8_t *restrict scratch)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_originalfast9_score ( const uint8_t *restrict  img,
uint16_t  stride,
const uint32_t *  featuresLoc,
uint32_t  numFeatures,
uint8_t  b,
uint8_t *restrict  score,
uint8_t *restrict  scratch 
)

Description:
This function computes the FAST9 score for a list of corners.
Parameters:
[in] *img Pointer to the image buffer.
[in] stride The stride of the image.
[in] *featuresLoc Co-ordinates of feature point. x and y ordinate each of unsigned 16 bit packed into 32 bit. Lower 16 bit should be x location.
[in] numFeatures Number of feature points given to API. Must be multiple of 8.
[in] b The threshold used while finding the fast9 corners. In practical scenario this value will not used.
[out] score Output score for each input feature point
[in] scratch Scratch buffer needed by kernel. User should provide 463 bytes buffer no alignment is needed.
Assumptions:
  • score size should be at least as large as the numFeatures value.
  • numFeatures should be multiple of 8.
  • If all the corners given to API is the real corner points found through fast9 algorithm then input will not be used inside this kernel.
  • input b will be returned as a score for a point, if that point is not a candidate for corner. like for flat image no point can be a corner.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed point processors.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
